with particulars of Size, Price, Month of Publication,
and Name of Publisher of

THE PUBLISHERS' CIRCULAR & BOOKSELLERS' RECORD of BRITISH & FOREIGN LITERATURE
is published by Messrs. Sampson Low & Co. Limited, every Saturday. Price Three-halfpence.
In addition to a Leading Article and Notes and Announcements of Literary Interest
it gives full particulars of all New Books published during the Week.
LONDON:
SAMPSON LOW, MARSTON & COMPANY, LIMITED,
PUBLISHERS' CIBCULAR OFFICE, ST. DUNSTAN'S HOUSE, FETTER LANE, FLEET STREET, E.C
1901.


## p. 2 (#6) ################################################

04/१
, 325
1900
PREFATORY NOTE.
---
ou-
To this volume is appended a List of Works on Angling, Fish, and
Fisheries, which supplements the Bibliotheca Piscatoria published in 1883
by Mr. T. Satchell. We must thank the Hon. D. B. Fearing, of Newport,
R.I., U.S.A., for the loan of his catalogue of angling books, from which
many of the entries in this list were obtained.
The names and complete addresses of publishers will be found at the
end of this volume. Under the book titles the names of the publishers are
given in brief : ‘Low,' for instance, instead of the 17 words and two letters
which will be found at the foot of the title-page of this book. If the office of
a publishing firm is not in London, the name of the town is placed between
parentheses before the publisher's name, thus: -(Oxford) BLACKWELL.' Then
the publisher's name, the word 'publisher, and the name of the town usually
make address enough to find him.
For the first time we have added a List of the principal publishers in
the United States. It will be found following the names of those in the
United Kingdom.
Collections, Libraries, and Series of books will be found grouped under
the heading Series. Publications issued by Learned Societies should be
sought for under the heading Transactions. We regret that some pub-
lishers and secretaries of societies did not reply to our circular in time
to allow us to include their information in this volume, but it will appear
eventually in Vol. VI. of the English Catalogue of Books.
To those many publishers and secretaries who by kind and prompt
replies have assisted us to complete this list of English books published
in 1900 we tender hearty thanks. We have especially to express our
obligation to Mr. W. K. FORTESCUE (compiler of a Subject Index to
Modern Works), and to many bibliographers and authors who have
sent additions or corrections.
Should any of our readers notice the absence of a title which ought
to have appeared in this volume, or know of the publication of a work
which will not be subscribed to the trade in the usual way,' or for any
other reason is likely to escape our next volume, we shall be much obliged
if he will send copy of title, giving name of author, price of book, name of
publisher, and month and year of publication, to Catalogue Dept.,
S. LOW, MARSTON & CO., LTD.,
St. Dunstan's House, Fetter Lane, E.C.

where possible in inches, 1 inch =2} centimetres.

The papers read before the members are published |
in the Transactions of the Institution of Mining
Engineers, Newcastle-upon-Tyne, price £3. 12s.
per annum (2 vols.)
Separate special publications are :--Annual Report
of the Council and Accounts for the year 1899–
1900; List of Council, Officers, and Members for
the Year 1900–1901 ; The Charter and Byelaws;
&c.
Institution of Civil Engineers (Great George Street,
Westminster, S.W.) Proceedings, Vols. 139-142
Institution of Electrical Engineers (28 Victoria Street,
S.W.) Journal, Vol. 29, pts. 142 to 146; conjointly
with the Physical Society, Vol. 3, Nos. 25 to 86 of
Science Abstracts and an Index number
Institution of Junior Engineers (47 Fentiman Road,
S.W.) Transactions, Vol. 10, 1899–1900
Institution of Mechanical Engineers (Storey's Gate,
St. James's Park, S.W.) Proceedings, July and
October-December 1899; January-March, April,
and June, 1900 (5 vols.)
Institution of Mining Engineers (Neville Hall,
Newcastle-upon-Tyne). Comprising the North of
England Institute of Mining and Mechanical
Engineers; the Chesterfield and Midland Counties
Institution of Engineers; the North Staffordshire
Institute of Mining and Mechanical Engineers; the
Midland Institute of Mining, Civil, and Mechanical
Engineers; the South Staffordshire and East
Worcestershire Institute of Mining Engineers : and
the Mining Institute of Scotland. Papers read
before any of these Institutes are published in the
Transactions of the Institution of Mining Engineers,
Vols. 18 and 19, 1899–1900, £1. 10s. each. Most of
the papers are also issued separately as pamphlets

## p. 237 (#243) ############################################

A LIST OF BOOKS
RELATING TO
FISH, FISHING, AND FISHERIES
TO SUPPLEMENT THE
BIBLIOTHECA PISCATORIA
OF
T. WESTWOOD and T. SATCHELL
PUBLISHED IN 1883.
This List includes Works published between 1883 and 1900,
and some older Books not mentioned in the
* Bibliotheca Piscatoria.'
LONDON:
SAMPSON LOW, MARSTON & COMPANY
(LIMITED),
St. Dunstan's bouse,
FETTER LANE, FLEET STREET, E.C.
1901.


## p. 238 (#244) ############################################

NOTE.
The following List of Works on Angling, Fish, and Fisheries has
been compiled from various sources, and includes all the more
important works published since the appearance of The Bibliotheca
Piscatoria in 1883, as well as particulars of some works previously
published not mentioned in that work. For many of the entries I
am indebted to an American angler and subscriber to the Fishing
Gazette, the Hon. D. B. Fearing, of Newport, R.I., U.S.A. I shall
be greatly obliged to collectors of angling books and others who will
send me a note of any corrections in, or omissions from, this list
which they may notice. They should be addressed to R. B. Marston,
Editor Fishing Gazette, St. Dunstan's House, Fetter Lane, London.


## p. 239 (#245) ############################################

DIRECTORY OF PUBLISHERS.
This list of publishers, with their addresses, has been principally compiled with a view to supplying informa-
tion regarding the books in the English Catalogue for 1900. This will explain the inclusion of many firms in the
list who can scarcely, in the strict acceptation of the term, be called publishers, since the publication of books
forms only an occasional portion of their business.

## p. (#275) ################################################


SPECIAL OFFER.
Indispensable to
Every Library.
The Publishers of the English Catalogue have decided to
offer to Readers of the Publishers' CIRCULAR, for a limited period only,
the following volumes of the English Catalogue at a
greatly reduced price :-
Vol. 3.-1872-1880 - - published at 428.
Index Vol. 3.-1874-1880
► 18s.
Vol. 4.-1881-1889 -
» 525, 6d.
Index Vol. 4.-1881-1889
», 31s. 6d.
Vol. 5.-1890-1897 - -
,, 84s. net.
N.B.-Vol. 5 is classified in one alphabet, and therefore requires no Index Volume.
Here are five volumes in all, the published prices of which, as can be seen,
amounted to a sum of £11. 8s.
THESE ARE NOW OFFERED AT FOUR GUINEAS NET
THE SET OF FIVE' VOLUMES.
WHAT THE OFFER MEANS.
Vol. 5, until to-day, could only be obtained for £4. 48.; an expenditure of the same
sum will now give you four additional volumes-the five all bound in half leather.
We make a present, that is to say, of four books published at 428., 528. 6d., 188. and
31s. 6d. respectively.
WHY
THE OFFER SHOULD BE ACCEPTED.
Because it is a chance that will never occur again. We cannot offer Vols. 1 and 2
because they are out of print. Vol. 3 is getting low, and the time must come,
sooner or later, when Vols. 4 and 5 will get scarce. They will not be reprinted.
Those who have already purchased Vol. 5 and are in want of the
preceding Two Volumes and Indexes can be supplied with them for Two Guineas Net
Cash-otherwise the offer for the set cannot be broken.
The ENCYCLOPÆDIA BRITANNICA can be reprinted.
The ENGLISH CATALOGUE cannot.
Those persons who are fortunate enough to possess the Five Volumes of the English
Catalogue and Index Volumes can find the title, author's name, and published price of any
book published from 1835 to 1897. 300,000 books were published during those sixty years.
We cannot offer you the five complete volumes, but we do offer you the last three and two
Index Volumes, which give you the books published from 1872 to 1897; but the available sets
are few, and you must order quickly on the following or similar Order Form:-
Date
ORDER FORM.
To Mesars. SAMPSON Low, MARSTON & Co., LTD.,
St. Dunstan's House, Fetter Lane,
London, E.O.
I enclose chegue for £4. 48. Please send me the following volumes of the ENGLISH
CATALOGUE :-Vols. 3, 4, 5, and Index Vols. 3 and 4 as described in the advertisement.
Yours faithfully,
Name and Address
